results.title: Doubts About the Promised Bounty of Genetically Modified Crops
results.abstract: Higher yields with less pesticides was the sales pitch for genetically modified seeds. But that has not proved to be the outcome in the United States.

multimedia.caption: Arnaud Rousseau, a sixth-generation farmer in France, in a field of rapeseed. Twenty years ago, Europe largely rejected genetic modification at the same time the United States and Canada were embracing it.
multimedia.copyright: Ed Alcock for The New York Times
